com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Interface ActivityController.Interceptor

Enclosing class:
ActivityController
public static interface ActivityController.Interceptor

An interface which is queried during the various life cycle events of a LifeCycle.

An interceptor is the ideal place for centralizing in one place many of the Activity/Fragment entity life cycle events.

See Also:
ActivityController.registerInterceptor(Interceptor)

Nested Class Summary
static class ActivityController.Interceptor.InterceptorEvent
          Defines all the events handled by the ActivityController.Interceptor.
 
Method Summary
 void onLifeCycleEvent(android.app.Activity activity, java.lang.Object component, ActivityController.Interceptor.InterceptorEvent event)
          Invoked every time a new event occurs on the provided activity/component.
 

Method Detail

onLifeCycleEvent

void onLifeCycleEvent(android.app.Activity activity,
                      java.lang.Object component,
                      ActivityController.Interceptor.InterceptorEvent event)
Invoked every time a new event occurs on the provided activity/component. For instance, this is an ideal for logging application usage analytics.

The framework ensures that this method will be invoked from the UI thread, hence the method implementation should last a very short time!

Caution: if an exception is thrown during the method execution, the application will crash!

Parameters:
activity - the activity on which a life cycle event occurs ; cannot be null
component - the component on which the life cycle event occurs ; may be null
event - the event that has just happened
See Also:
ActivityController#onLifeCycleEvent()
